questions.clue: In Greek mythology, this king's touch turned everything to gold.
According to Norse mythology, this hammer-wielding god is associated with thunder.
In ancient Egyptian mythology, this god of the underworld is often depicted with a green face.
This Hindu god is known as the destroyer and is part of the Trimurti.
In Japanese mythology, this sun goddess is said to have hidden in a cave, causing darkness in the world.
This physicist developed the theory of relativity, fundamentally changing our understanding of space and time.
This vaccine, developed by Jonas Salk, was the first effective prevention against a crippling disease known as poliomyelitis.
In 1953, James Watson and Francis Crick proposed the double helix structure for this molecule essential for heredity.
This scientific technique, developed in the 1980s, allows for the amplification of DNA sequences.
This groundbreaking technology, first demonstrated in 2012, allows for precise editing of the genome and has applications in disease treatment.
In this epic poem, Odysseus faces cyclopes, sirens, and a long voyage home after the Trojan War.
This novella by Robert Louis Stevenson features a journey to a mysterious island in search of buried treasure.
In this novel by Daniel Defoe, the title character is shipwrecked on a deserted island and spends years trying to escape.
In Chaucer's 'The Canterbury Tales', pilgrims tell stories on their journey to the shrine of this saint.
In 'The Divine Comedy', Dante journeys through the three realms of the dead, guided by Virgil and Beatrice.
In 1911, this famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci was stolen from the Louvre by an Italian handyman.
In 1990, two men disguised as police officers stole 13 pieces of art, including works by Vermeer and Rembrandt, from this Boston museum.
This 1895 painting by Edvard Munch, depicting an agonized figure against a tumultuous sky, was stolen from Norway's National Gallery in 1994.
In 2002, two paintings by Vincent van Gogh, including 'View of the Sea at Scheveningen', were stolen from this Amsterdam museum.
In 2000, masked thieves stole Paul Cézanne's 'View of Auvers-sur-Oise' from this city's Ashmolean Museum.
This Mexican street food favorite consists of a tortilla filled with meat, cheese, and various toppings.
Popular in Japan, this savory pancake is often filled with cabbage and topped with a special sauce and bonito flakes.
These Indian snacks are deep-fried pastries filled with spiced potatoes, peas, and sometimes meat.
In Thailand, this stir-fried noodle dish is typically made with shrimp or chicken, eggs, and peanuts.
In Turkey, this street food is a thin flatbread rolled with spiced minced meat, tomatoes, and onions, often referred to as 'Turkish pizza'.

final.clue: In 1513, this Spanish explorer became the first European to view the Pacific Ocean from the New World, calling it the 'South Sea'.
final.answer: Who is Vasco Núñez de Balboa?
